Title: Provides for a review of rating territory definitions for non-business automobile insurance policies
Summary: Establishes as a distinct territory for purposes of rating private passenger nonbusiness automobile insurance policies, a certain city with a population between 19,040 and 25,000 which is geographically contiguous to a city with a population between 292,648 and 350,000; provides that the superintendent may require insurers to adjust existing or establish new territory definitions based on such review.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to providing for a review of certain existing rating territory definitions for non-business automobile insurance policies
